content:
Good morning! I'm Jeyachandran, your hiring officer. It's great to finally meet you in person. I've had a chance to review your resume, and I have to say, it looks quite impressive. You have a diverse range of experience in various technologies, including React, Node.js, and MongoDB. Your education background in AI and Machine Learning is also impressive.

Before we dive into the technical aspects, I'd like to ask you: Can you tell me what sparked your interest in AI and Machine Learning, and how do you think your skills in these areas will help you contribute to our organization?
I Esar I have completed many projects in full stock dollar.

It sounds like you have a strong background in full-stack development. Can you tell me more about one of your projects that you're particularly proud of? What was the technology stack used, and what did you learn from working on that project?

Yes sir, I worked in the full search for event management system. It cast four users and only staff and club member and club head and student. and uh club member create a event and send to the club head and once verified a club cut uh to the admin once verify approve means and the event is a creator successfully and in the display even in student page

It sounds like you developed an event management system with roles such as staff, club member, club head, and student. Can you elaborate on the technical aspects of this project? For example, what technologies did you use for the front-end, back-end, and database? And how did you implement the user authentication and authorization logic to ensure that each user can only access their respective pages?

in Clinton I used React, in backend I used EspressJS and I used 3Dajjs in Lobo backend I used Espress and I used DB in MongoDB and I used JWT token in authentication and I used RazerWave for the payment verification

So, you used React for the frontend, ExpressJS and Node.js for the backend, MongoDB for the database, and JWT tokens for authentication. You also used Razorpay for payment verification.

That's a good mix of technologies! Can you tell me more about how you implemented the JWT token authentication? For example, how did you generate and verify the tokens, and how did you handle token renewal and revocation?
